message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC 

Reasoning: The paper proposes a model-agnostic interpretability method for medical decision-making systems that involves training a simple recurrent neural network model to produce descriptive sentences to clarify the decision of deep learning classifiers. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, which are commonly used in the computer science sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The task of detecting hip fractures from frontal pelvic x-rays involves computer vision (cs.CV) techniques. The paper also discusses the use of deep learning classifiers (cs.LG) and interpretable artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper evaluates the effectiveness of the proposed method in terms of its usability by doctors, which falls under the sub-category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
